Title: great camera
Cons: if you don't know enough of how to play with this camera, too many features would be unused, but this would be user's issue, not camera's!
Pros:
as soon as I've seen few well done pics, I knew I lost a lot of time and cash on those point and shoot camera along the years.
Especially if you do family pics, or business related - it is a much better choice for long term!
Comments: i would recommend it!

Cons: Menus have a bit of a learning curve
Pros:
Best Picture Quality for the Price
Lenses are much less expensive than competitive brands
Easy to use for new photographer
Comments: I purchased this camera as my 1st personal DSLR and it has yet to disappoint me the only limitation to this camera is the photographer's imagination.

Title: Best Camera for Price
Cons: I wish for the price they would through in a cheap case or protective body glove.
Pros: First timer with the SLR camera.  Did all of reading on what type of SLR to get.  Video was not a deal buster so this device worked out great.  Plus i have a friend who is a professional photographer and she thought this would be the best one for us.  Up until now we used point and shot digital cameras.  This is a 100% improvement of speed and picture quality.  I would recommend this camera
Comments: bought the OEM 75-300MM zoom lens and the action photos are just amazing.

Title: Awesome Camera
Cons: Doesn't come with a remote...no video, but that's what I paid for...
Pros: Takes excellent pictures...much better than my old Canon Powershot...lots of features...I can control whatever I want
Comments: exactly what I expected

Title: A good camera
Cons:
Can be buggy. Make sure you have the latest firmware installed. Live View is fussy and can't be used in 'auto' modes.
The lens. The 18-55mm is a terd. No video. No TTL flash socket. No off camera flash support other than the hotshoe.
Pros: Light weight. Many accessories. Battery life.
Comments: This is an extinct model. Wal Mart is blowing these out for $425 on clearance... and that's with a 2GB SD card, the 18-55mm lens, battery, charger, software, strap and a bag!

Title: Great Camera
Cons: It doesn't do ANY video. I knew this before I bought it but oh well.
Pros: This is so much better than a point and shoot. This is my first DSLR camera and it has been great. I was a little concerned at first about it "only" being 10 MP but after doing some research and after seeing the quality I was impressed.
Comments: This camera has great features. It's a great camera for an amateur photographer.

Title: Awsome Replacement
Cons: The battery will die if left in the camera, but at least its rechargable.
Pros: I love this camera. I have always prefered a Canon camera. This is a very simple and easy to use DSL camera to use. The auto feature settings make switching from close up to action a breeze. Image stablizer is great and pictures look crisp.
Comments: I bought this to replace my AE-1 from back in the 80's. No more film. I hope that this one will last as long.

Title: Great dslr
Cons: none so far
Pros: Feels solid, is quiet and quick. Good lenses and great selection with the EOS compatibility. Does it all for me.
Comments: Finally got a digital slr after having a 35mm years ago. This is soo much more fun and very easy to use with great results. What a treat to own this baby. And, Newegg had such a deal!

Title: Good solid Entry level DSLR Camera
Cons: The eye piece that looks comfortable actually not that much, I initially thought that eye cushion be little "puffy" feeling to it but is more like nothing is there.
Pros: The camera is very easy to get used to and the function/settings are pretty easy too.
Comments: I like this camera alot so far, I highly recommended to entry level DSLR people since the price is good and shooting is also well done.

Title: Excellent
Cons: None
Pros: Great camera. Pictures are so much better than point n shoot.
Comments: Get yourself a 58mm B+W UV filter to protect the expensive lens from damage.

Comments: Get yourself a 58mm B+W UV filter to protect the expensive lens from damage.
